display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; overflow: hidden; max-height: 280px; max-width: 420px; width: 420px; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.p: 1. package.json has the paths to the files that are needed to be tested.
2. Gruntfiles hold references to tasks that can be run in cli, it gives information on the configurations and how to handle the resolution of the

3. grunt-qunit-puppeteer-istanbul is a task that the gruntfile calls to run the grunt-lib-puppeteer-istanbul plugin. This plugin will receive information from the Gruntfile and from the plugin which will determine if the task was completed successfully.

4. grunt-lib-puppeteer-istanbul is a node binary script to spin up a puppeteer instances. grunt-lib-puppeteer-istanbul does not run qunit tests but rather runs the files in an instance of chromium (a chrome-canary build). The events fired off in the dom are then notified to the task which then handles the resolution of the task.
